bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, January 12, [1869]
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library

revisionDesc.change: Redate 1869 from Waldron's Trent note; revise all notes.
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Date note, cost of food for Jeff Whitman family, George's house construction, Walt's boarding situation
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p:
it seems like an age till i got your letter to day
i was glad to hear you was all safe i have had a letter from heydeHeyde saying hannaHannah is much better that she sleeps better and come out in the room to her meals i have got a box of things for her shall send them on thursday Thursday i got 10 1/2 yds of muslin and two dresses one a gingam gingham and one delain and a can of peaches and some other things and georgeGeorge will give me 2 dollar to put in) i put a note on the bundle a christmas Christmas present from walterWalter to hannaHannah so i hope she will get them all safe) i also got a letter from mattyMatty yesterday
saying she is better that her coughf cough is much better and she raises scarcely any they have a large parlor and their meals brought in and dishes took out at 200 dol dollars per month) georgeGeorge went but only stayed a few days they was repairing the works i told him when he went i was going to rest all the time but i was taken with such a lame back and side i was in a bad state for a few days but i have got better now) the house is a dooing doing this fine weather past has been good to work georgeyGeorgey seems very much pleasd with it) this is a short lette letter walterWalter dear i wish you could get a better room
These peeces pieces of a letter came here last week directed to you we could not make them out it came from new york New York
